question.text: Photosynthesis in <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></math> plants is relatively less limited by atmospheric <math><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math> levels because

options.text: effective pumping of  <math><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math>   into bundle sheath cells

RuBisCO in  <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></math>   plants has a higher affinity for  <math><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math>
four-carbon acids are the primary initial  <math><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math>  fixation products
the primary fixation of <math><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math> is mediated via PEP carboxylase

solution.text: Plants that can fix atmospheric carbon dioxide into phosphoenol pyruvic acid (PEP) in the presence of the enzyme PEP carboxylase to produce oxaloacetic acid are known as <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></math> plants. <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></math> cycle is more efficient and the <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></math> plants can absorb carbon dioxide even in low <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math> concentration, whereas the <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></math> plants fail to do that.
